citation.article-title: Humibacillus xanthopallidus gen. nov., sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Humibacillus xanthopallidus sp. nov.
Humibacillus xanthopallidus (xan.tho.pal′li.dus. Gr. adj. xanthos yellow; L. adj. pallidus pale; N.L. masc. adj. xanthopallidus pale yellow).
Growth occurs between pH 5 and 11 (optimal is pH 7), and between 7 and 32 °C (optimal temperatures are 27 and 32 °C for strains KV-663T and YM21-029, respectively).
In one-fifth-strength nutrient agar medium, growth occurs at up to 3 % (w/v) NaCl.
Assimilates d-galactose, d-glucose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, sucrose and trehalose, but not l-arabinose, d-fructose, maltose or d-xylose.

Alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, α-glucosidase and β-glucosidase are detected with the API ZYM enzyme assay; negative for N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase and α-fucosidase.
The DNA G+C content is 69–70 mol%.
Scanning electron micrograph of cells from a 2-day-old culture of strain KV-663T grown on GPM agar medium at 27 °C.
The type strain, KV-663T (=NRRL B-24471T=NBRC 101803T), was isolated from a soil sample collected from a paddy field.
YM21-029, isolated from lake sediment, is a second strain of the species.
